data.scheme_name: Development of Commercial Horticulture through Production and Post Harvest Management of Horticulture Crops - Integrated Post Harvest Management projects - Except NER & Hill States - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides credit linked subsidy @ 35% of the total project cost limited to Rs 50.75 lakh per project.
data.eligibility:
Eligible Activities:-
Infrastructure like pack houses, ripening chambers, pre-cooling units, cold rooms, and retail outlets for better storage and marketing of horticulture produce.
Includes primary processing for crops like fruits, vegetables, flowers, and cashews.
data.conditions:
All equipment, construction, and cultivation practices must comply with NHB and NCCD technical standards.
Projects must be completed within 18 months from the date of sanctioning the loan or issuance of the approval letter from the National Horticulture Board (NHB).
data.beneficiaries:
Eligible Activities:-
The Board will take up Integrated Post Harvest Management projects relating to Pack House, Ripening Chamber, Refer Van, Retail Outlets, Pre- cooling unit, Primary
processing etc. NHB will also take up projects in component mode and for standalone projects of PHM components.
Crops eligible: In case of primary processing, projects related to Fruits, Vegetables, Flowers, Aromatic plants and Cashew are only eligible for subsidy
data.prerequisites:
All equipment, construction, and cultivation practices must comply with NHB and NCCD technical standards.
Projects must be completed within 18 months from the date of sanctioning the loan or issuance of the approval letter from the National Horticulture Board (NHB).
data.context: The scheme was introduced to develop and boost agriculture industry
data.objective: Projects relating to the setting up of new units shall be technically and financially appraised to ensure and enable the entrepreneur to incorporate the latest available technology.
data.description: Scheme provides credit linked subsidy @ 35% of the total project cost limited to Rs 50.75 lakh per project.
data.how_to_apply:
Online application can be made through - http://nhb.gov.in/OnlineApplication/RegistrationForm.aspx
Apply through banks and other eligible financial institutions.
data.funding_facilitator: Banks and other eligible financial institutions.
data.funding_mechanism: The eligible units will get the benefit after the approval by National Horticulture Board for claim submitted
data.additional_info:
Maximum Project Costs Allowed for Subsidy Calculation:
Integrated Post-Harvest Management Projects:
Total cost: ₹145 lakh per project.
Subsidy:
35% (up to ₹50.75 lakh) in general areas.
50% (up to ₹72.50 lakh) in NE, hilly, and scheduled areas.
Component-Wise Cost Norms:
Pack House:
Cost: ₹4 lakh/unit (9m x 6m).
Subsidy: 50% of the capital cost.
Integrated Pack House (conveyor belt, sorting, grading, washing, drying):
Cost: ₹50 lakh/unit (9m x 18m).
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Pre-Cooling Unit:
Cost: ₹25 lakh/unit (6 MT).
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Cold Room (Staging):

Cost: ₹15 lakh/unit (30 MT).
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Mobile Pre-Cooling Unit:

Cost: ₹25 lakh/unit.
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Ripening Chamber:

Cost: ₹1 lakh/MT (11 cubic meters = 1 MT).
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Primary Processing (fruits, vegetables, flowers, aromatic plants, cashew):

Cost: ₹25 lakh/unit.
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
Retail Outlets (Environmentally Controlled):

Cost: ₹15 lakh/unit.
Subsidy: 35% (general) or 50% (hilly/scheduled areas).
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Signed copy of the print out of online submitted IPA Application 
2. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
3. Prescribed Cost of Application Form & Scheme Brochure (copy of online payment receipt or DD in original) 
4. Certified copy of Record of Rights over the piece of project land.  
5. Detailed Project Report (DPR) duly signed by promoter on each page of DPR 
6. Certified copy of Detailed Term Loan Sanction letter of lending Bank/FIs 
7. Certified copy of Caste Certificate issued by Competent Authority in case of SC/ST applicants 
8. Certified copy of Aadhaar Card of applicant (s) 
9. Certified of Incorporation  
10. MOA/AOA 
11. Certified copy of latest Audit report 
12. Certified copy of Board of Directors Resolution duly passed and authorizing signatory of application to apply for IPA 
10. Basic data sheet for Banana Ripening Unit/Reefer Van/Polyhouse/shade net house only 
11. Other KYC Documents
